intro: Lagrezia madagascariensis var. interrupta, commonly known as the Madagascar lily, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists worldwide.
